main event: On November 7, 1955, civilians reported seeing two bright objects in the sky near Elmira, New York, moving erratically for approximately 1.5 minutes before disappearing from view. The objects were not identified, and the probable causes remain unknown.
interesting points: The sighting took place at 12:00 midnight local time.
The objects were reported to have moved in an erratic manner before disappearing.
The report mentions a possible aircraft (A/C) as a comment.
The duration of the observation was approximately 1.5 minutes.
The report involved ground-radar observation and ground visual search.
sighted object: two bright, unidentified objects moving erratically in the sky
